tool.name: Remove.otulabels
tool.command:
echo 'remove.otulabels( #if $infile.otu.is_of_type("mothur.cons.taxonomy"): constaxonomy=$infile.otu, #end if #if $infile.otu.is_of_type("mothur.otu.corr"): otucorr=$infile.otu, #end if #if $infile.otu.is_of_type("mothur.axes"): corraxes=$infile.otu, #end if #if $infile.otu.is_of_type("mothur.list"): list=$infile.otu, #end if #if $infile.otu.is_of_type("mothur.shared"): shared=$infile.otu, #end if #if $infile.intype == "in_shared" and $infile.label: label=$infile.label, #end if accnos=$accnos )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur &&
## move output files to correct destination prefix="$infile.otu" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.pick.dat "$pick_out" && mv mothur.*.logfile "$logfile"

param.name: intype
param.label: Which type of files will you be supplying?

param.name: otu
param.label: shared/list - allows you to input a list file you wish to select OTUs from.

param.name: label
param.label: label - pick (one) OTU Label
param.help: By default first label in your file is used

param.name: otu
param.label: cons.taxonomy/otu.corr/axes file
param.help: constaxonomy file can be obtained by the running classify.otu tool, otucorr from otu.association tool, and corraxes from corr.axes command

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The remove.otulabels_ command removes otu labels from the output from classify.otu_, corr.axes_ and otu.association_. This can be useful especially with subsampled datasets or when groups have been selected.
.. _classify.otu: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Classify.otu .. _corr.axes: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Corr.axes .. _otu.association: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Otu.association .. _remove.otulabels: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Remove.otulabels
